## Time-dependent configuration interaction (TDCI)
- An arbitrary N-electronic wave function can be expressed exactly as a linear combination of all possible Slater determinants formed from a complete set of spin orbitals $\{\chi_{i}(r)\}$. ^[Sherrill, C. D. (1995). An introduction to configuration interaction theory. School of Chemistry and Biochemistry, Georgia Institute of Technology.]

- The configuration interaction wavefunction looks like this ^[Szabo, A., & Ostlund, N. S. (2012). Modern quantum chemistry: introduction to advanced electronic structure theory. Courier Corporation.]
:
    $$
    \begin{equation*}
    |\Phi\rangle= c_{\text{HF}}\left|\Psi_{\text{HF}}\right\rangle+\sum_{r a} c_{a}^{r}\left|\Psi_{a}^{r}\right\rangle+\sum_{a<b, r<s} c_{a b}^{r s}\left|\Psi_{a b}^{r s}\right\rangle+\sum_{r<s<t, a<b<c} c_{a b c}^{r s t}\left|\Psi_{a b c}^{r s t}\right\rangle+\ldots
    \end{equation*}
    $$

- Pure many-body electron dynamics can be described by solving the time-dependent Schr&ouml;dinger equation (TDSE) numerically in terms of the CI wavefunction ^[Klamroth, T. (2003). Laser-driven electron transfer through metal-insulator-metal contacts: Time-dependent configuration interaction singles calculations for a jellium model. Physical Review B, 68(24), 245421.] $^{,}$ ^[Krause, P., Klamroth, T., & Saalfrank, P. (2005). Time-dependent configuration-interaction calculations of laser-pulse-driven many-electron dynamics: Controlled dipole switching in lithium cyanide. The Journal of chemical physics, 123(7), 074105.].  
    $$
       i\hbar \ \frac{\partial|\Phi\rangle}{\partial t} = \hat{H} |\Phi\rangle 
    $$

## HHG
- HHG in bare Helium atom usin AQZ-ARO8g basissets with heuristic lifetime models.
- Pulse parameters: 
  + Wavelength : 800nm 
  + FWHM: 26.7fs
  + Intensity: 10$^{14}$ W/cm$^{2}$

## Changes to Workflow
- Modification to existing workflow in Fortran : `(12-24 hours of coding)`
  + Integral input using hdf5 format
  + CISD using exact closed form expressions
  + Lifetime models for HHG 

- Alternative: Use PSI4 plugin feature ^[PSI4 plugins : [https://psicode.org/psi4manual/master/plugins.html](https://psicode.org/psi4manual/master/plugins.html)].  `(2-3 days fulltime coding)`
  + ```
    >>> psi4 --plugin-name myplugin
    ```
  + Automatically wraps existing C,C++ and Fortran code with CMake 
  + Clean python interface with `pybind11`
  + Use already written python code for other features.
